alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 10:38AM EST until February 27 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From Friday evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above 20.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 20.6 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.6 feet on 02/27/1934. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 11 PM Thursday, February 24th.
